actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide that, with respect to any federal election, no expenditure may be made by any candidate or political committee unless there are sufficient funds in the checking account maintained by such committee to pay the amount of such expenditure and all other checks drawn on such account and unpaid, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit expenditures by any candidate or political committee unless there are sufficient funds in the checking account maintained by such committee to pay the amount of such expenditure. Prohibits any person from providing goods or services to a candidate or political committee until such person has received payment.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide that, with respect to any federal election, no expenditure may be made by any candidate or political committee unless there are sufficient funds in the checking account maintained by such committee to pay the amount of such expenditure and all other checks drawn on such account and unpaid, and for other purposes.
